A group of women protesting in support of circumcision of girls lured activists opposed to the practice and attacked them at Enoosaen Village in Transmara, Narok County. Injuries not known.
The Kenya Defence Forces killed eight al Shabaab and injured several others during an encounter with the insurgents in Basuba, Lamu county. A KDF soldier died while three others were injured.

Pokot cattle rustlers struck Namawanga village inhabited by members of the Luhya community and shot dead a local farmer before stealing three bulls from his home. In revenge, Luhya tribesmen hacked to death a Pokot man after they found him ferrying two passengers to Karnyarkwat market. The killing of the man sparked off protest from members of the Pokot community who thronged to Kapkoi market vowing to revenge over the killing of their tribesmen.
URP supporters disrupt a demonstration in Bomet concerning the location of a university, no reported violence. Police forces dispersed the two groups.

Pokot cattle rustlers struck Namawanga village inhabited by members of the Luhya community and shot dead a local farmer before stealing three bulls from his home. In revenge, Luhya tribesmen hacked to death a Pokot man who operates a motor cycle taxis after they found him ferrying two passengers to Karnyarkwat market. The killing of the man sparked off protest from members of the Pokot community who thronged to Kapkoi market vowing to revenge over the killing of their tribesmen.

Pokot cattle rustlers struck Namawanga village inhabited by members of the Luhya community and shot dead a local farmer before stealing three bulls from his home. In revenge, Luhya tribesmen hacked to death a Pokot man who operates a motor cycle taxis after they found him ferrying two passengers to Karnyarkwat market. The killing of the man sparked off protest from members of the Pokot community who thronged to Kapkoi market vowing to revenge over the killing of their tribesmen.
Two demonstrators were shot and injured by police in Mau Narok during a protest against increased road accidents.
Traders at Kalundu market held a demonstration in Kitui town, protesting against high market charges by the county government.
Fishermen clash with police after officials closed a corridor leading to Lake Naivasha and Karagita beach in Naivasha. No reported injuries.
Following an attack by armed robbers in Ol Moran village of Laikipia residents protest insecurity.
Medical worker protesters clash with a group that was attempting to stop them. One man is injured after he was hit in the face with a stone.
Pokot gunmen killed a school guard during the late morning hours. Motive unknown.
Boda boda riders and traders protest a new law that prohibits animals to travel through the CBD of Bomet.
A burnt mans body is discovered at a coffee plantation near Kangaru in Engu. Perpetrators not known. The time of death may have been up to three days before its discovery on 03/01.
An irate mob in Nyatike killed a suspected cattle thief while two of his colleagues escaped with serious injuries on [the afternoon of (28/12).
Police and a group of journalists clash after police objected to a story they were covering. Injuries not known.
A hotel security guard is shot and killed and his colleague injured after ten gunmen dressed in police uniform attacked the two in Diani. Perpetrators not identified.
Non-violent activity: Suspected al Shabaab attack a Lamu bound bus in Nyangoro. Four shots were reported fired, though no one was reported injured.
About 600 members of the Ogiek community evicted from Cengalo forest in South Nandi catchment area protested along the nearby Kapsabet-Nabkoi highway against lack of compensation.
A man has been lynched in Kaloleni village, Masii location, Mwala district after he was caught with two stolen hens.
At least ten people are killed following two days of ethnic clashes in Kinango, Kwale County. Both communities claimed grazing rights on a ranch.

A man was beaten to death and set on fire by residents in Riandu village, Mbeere North subcounty after it became believed he assaulted a small boy. The date of the attack is not known - the source is dated 18/12.
At least ten people are killed following two days of ethnic clashes in Kinango, Kwale County. Both communities claimed grazing rights on a ranch.
One man was seriously injured and property worth thousands of shillings destroyed after members of the Kikuyu and Maasai communities clashed over a parcel of land near Eburu Forest.
Two people were injured as herders from the Tugen community battled suspected Pokot bandits. The battle broke out at Chemoe, near the Baringo North and Tiaty subcounty border.
Residents of Kainuk protest insecurity in their area after a spate of increased armed banditry along the Lodwa-Kitale road.
The source reports six have died at the hands of vigilantes over the past six days in West Sabatia, Vihiga County. Specific dates of each instance are not known.

Nandi militia attack the Luhya village of Kuvasali (Obasari) in a suspected revenge attack. The violence, which broke up at 9a.m. [0600 gmt] has seen over 20 houses burnt, animals killed and plantations torched by attackers. Many residents fled the area. Causalities not reported.

Defusal: An explosive device is discovered in Kenyatta Barracks along the Gilgil-Nyahururu road. The device was discovered before it could be detonated. Perpetrators not known. Date not provided - source dated 08/12.
Students of Egerton University riot over persistent power outages. Property was destroyed, two buildings were set on fire and students looted shops. Ten arrests. No reported injuries.
Residents of Matuu town, Machakos county, took to the streets to protest demolition of kiosks by the county government.
Elegeyo-Marakwet residents protest over a road overgrown with foliage, causing passage difficult.
Hundreds of women staged a demonstration to protest against their husbands neglect of family responsibilities.
Al Shabaab lines and executes 15 non-Muslim farmers by firing squad in Mado Gashi.
Protesters against insecurity throw stones at a bus and raid a Somali-owned hotel in Mwingi. Police shot into the air to disperse the mob.
A group protesting area insecurity become entangled in running battles with police. Twelve students were treated for injuries at area hospitals.
Nyandarua residents protested against delay in constructing the 45km Mairo-Inya Shamata road. The residents barricaded the road for most of the day.

At least 28 people were killed after suspected Al-Shabaab militants attacked a Nairobi-bound bus in Omar Jilo, Mandera County in north-east Kenya. Witness said the attackers ordered all off the bus, divided the passengers along ethnic lines - Somali and non-Somali, shooting all non-Somalis. Many of the deceased were teachers.
A group of internally displaced people in Gilgil protested at the office of the deputy county commissioner demanding to be given relief food.
At least five people were killed and four others reported missing following clashes in Dukana, Marsabit County or rights to cattle and property.
Hundreds of residents invaded a 60,000-acre ranch in Taita Taveta belonging to a cooperative in protest of land grabbing by a third party.
Two suspected criminals were beaten up and burned by a mob in Chuka Igambangombe constituency. Police rescued the suspects, who suffered severe burns.

At least eight people were killed and four others seriously injured in inter- communal clashes in northern Kenyas Isiolo County. The clash reportedly lasted for several hours. The clash occurred at Leruko on Isiolo side, a few meters from the bridge that connects Isiolos Buffalo Springs game reserve with Samburu Park.
Residents protest in Lodwar over area insecurity for a second day.

A security operation against a group of Pokot militia yields the recovery of weapons and the deaths of six bandits, who had been launching attacks in the area recently. An MP said banditry attacks were instigated by people who want Kapedo to be annexed to Baringo.
Following heavy-handed treatment by police against a MP, residents of Cheptiret protest the action, calling for the local police station to be shut down. Exact date not known - source date is 07/11.

A Kapseret MP is slapped, pushed to the ground and stamped on the chest for refusing to comply with a police traffic order. The action spurred a protest against the police. Exact date not known - source date is 07/11.

Students protest in Lodwar, Turkana county over recent insecurity in the region. The group threatened to halt oil exploration in the area if the government did not act. The protest is mainly a reaction to an attack on a police post in Kapedo over the weekend.
Residents of Homa Bay town and its environs protest against a three-day power blackout.
Residents protest against an MP over a tax law violation.

A group of youths threw stones at Administration Police officers on night curfew patrol in Lamu. The officers were pelted with stones from a rooftop. No reported injures. The rioters were adverse to the curfew.

One person was hacked to death and four others seriously injured in a fresh attack in Bora Moyo village of Kipini. The violence began when a militia from Garjel community attacked the town when they believed its residents had stolen a herd of goats.

At least 24 police officers and Kenya Police Reservists (KPR) are feared dead, 17 injured, in a fresh attack in Kapedo in Tiaty Sub-county Baringo County after Pokot raiders attacked the at Lomelo and Kapau areas of the city.
The Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology (JKUAT) has been closed indefinitely after students went on rampage over a fee.

Seven police members are dead and 17 missing following an attack on their post by local tribesmen. Attackers targeted three police vehicles and burned one of them. The motive for the attack is not known. A similar attack occurred in the area the previous week.
Traders in Lamu protest for a second consecutive day. Police reported involvement.
A vigilante mob lynch a murder suspect in Mukindu village in Ol Kalou.

Lamu residents have again taken to the streets to protest the continued extension of the night curfew which has been in force for more than three months now. Police were deployed to disperse the protesters.
Students of Laikipia University in Kitale and Kapenguria protest the college CEOs decision to relocate them to the Eldoret campus.

Mutige Secondary School students walked out in protest against the administrations failure to address their grievances (the students want medical attention for the injured, new toilets, transport and leakage in classrooms and dormitories fixed). The more than 200 students marched to the counties headquarters in Kerugoya.
Residents of Majengo town in Vihiga county protest, demanding an audience with the Governor of the region to express their grievance over a recent spate of robberies.
Suspected local tribesmen attack a police post in Kapedo. Five dead, including three police officers.

Residents of Maguguni protest along the Mombasa-Nairobi highway for five hours to protest grabbing of the land by CORD corporation leader Raila Odinga. CORD is apparently interested in petroleum prospects on the plot.

Mashujaa Day celebrations were disrupted when supporters of a Kirinyaga Central MP (TNA) engaged youths (affiliation unknown) at Kerugoya Stadium. Chaos erupted when the youths stormed the venue of the event and started booing the MP as he addressed residents. Injuries reported.
200  Muslims demonstrated against the 6pm-6am curfew in [Kenya] on Lamu Island. The group asserted the curfew hurts the local fishing economy.
Unknown gunmen killed a police officer near the border with Somalia before escaping.

Drivers in Makutano and Kapenguria towns, West Pokot protested against the poor state of the Makutano-Alale road outside of Makutano. They blocked the road to the governor and county commissioners offices for several hours.

A senior Kenyan county official escaped death narrowly after an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded as he was being driven to his office in the border town of Rhamu, Mandera. Perpetrators not known. Two injuries reported.
Members of the Olomismis Group Ranch in Trans Mara protested against their officials mismanagement. The exact location of the protest is not known.

Drivers in Makutano and Kapenguria towns, West Pokot protested against the poor state of the Makutano-Alale road outside of Makutano. They blocked the road to the governor and county commissioners offices for several hours.

Protesters blocked the Nairobi Nakuru highway at Kwambira in Limuru after a 43 year old man was found murdered near his home. The protesters lit bonfires and blocked the road with stones, accusing the government of laxity in providing security.

Five passengers in two Miraa [mild narcotic] vans from Lamu to Ijara town were during the morning hours hijacked by suspected al Shabaab militia, which was later confirmed. The incident took place between Milimani and Basuba area in Lamu East sub-county. The five were taken to an unknown location. Kenyan security forces launched a search mission in response.

Residents of Teso North took to the streets to protest against the state of roads in the sub county. The protest, which drew more than 100 participants from Angurai, Aedo Moru and Kakapel, blamed politicians for the poor infrastructure. The exact location of the protest was not reported.
A section of Maseno University students engaged police in running battles in a strike due to the disruption of the student union elections by some candidates supporters. No reported injuries.
Rival Maasai groups clash over land ownership at a farm in Nakuru. One death, one injury reported.
Residents of Kinangop in Nyandarua county held a demonstration to protest the murder of a businessman. The protesters accused a local for the death.
Boda boda motorcyclists in Kinale, Lari sub county, protest against an AP officer after an arrest of a colleague which they thought unjustified.

A vigilante group attack a group of suspected witchdoctors at Kiptuilong village, Elgeyo Marakwet County. Some residents claimed the family had bewitched an old man in the village. Some of the victims were admitted to a hospital with serious injuries.
Two men Degodia men looking for their lost donkeys were attacked by Garre militia at Bula Dawa, Rhamu sub county, one death, one injury. The two clans have a history of rivalry.

Youth paralysed business on the Nairobi-Mombasa highway after they barricaded the road and lit fires in Voi to protest against discrimination in employment of locals at the Standard Gauge Railway project, which has employed foreign labour. No reported violence.
Residents lynch a suspected cattle thief in Chemelil. [size=no report]

Residents of Mukunike village in Kilimambogo, Kiambu county protested the demolition of 50 houses by a local quarry operator. They used boulders to block the Thika-Garissa road for 3 hours bringing traffic at Kilimambogo centre to a standstill.
Students at Mucharage Girls Secondary School in Othaya went on rampage, breaking windows and staging a class walkout over the schools policy toward sick student sick leave. No injuries reported.
Students at Mathenge TTI protest a lack of a television station broadcast at their institute.

At least four people were shot and seriously wounded by police after a meeting to discuss the ouster of Makueni Governor. Those wounded include [the Governors] chief of staff, a bodyguard and two county officials who were allegedly shot when the county assemblys security personnel opened fire to disperse a charged crowd.

Transport in Kabarnet town bus stage temporarily stopped when more than 200 drivers protested against hiring and firing of Baringo county vehicles drivers. The group later proceeded to the office of the Governor.
A man was shot dead at Lonyangelem village in West Pokot by suspected raiders from the neighbouring Turkana county.
One person was killed and another seriously injured after a mob attacked them in Baringo under suspicion of practising witchcraft.
Villagers clashed with a group of illegal sand harvesters near a bank of the Tuva river. One villager sustained a stone wound.
Residents of Emsoo ward, Keiyo North have demonstrated against the building of a planned training institute in another village.

Anti-terrorism police forces gun down a suspected and wanted al Shabaab member during an early morning raid on their hideout. It is believed the target of the operation was responsible for the killing of a German tourist.
Maungu residents in Voi protested against the extraction of stones from Marasi Hill by the China Roads and Bridges Company that is constructing a railway.
A mob at Kedowa market, Kipkelion East constituency, attacked a man suspected of cow theft. They beat up Nicholas Omwenga and lynched him before setting his van on fire.

Transponders at the Ndarugu quarries in Juja absconded their roles for two consecutive days over a dilapidated access road. [The workers] blocked the road and demolished kiosks where the council employees collect the levies.
Supporters of two teachers unions clash in Bomet, causalities, injuries not known.

Transponders at the Ndarugu quarries in Juja absconded their roles for two consecutive days over a dilapidated access road. [The workers] blocked the road and demolished kiosks where the council employees collect the levies.

One civilian is killed and two police officers injured in an attack on a lorry carrying supplies for a food programme. The attackers are unknown, but are believed to be related to an ongoing clash between the Degodia and Garre clans.
A suspected rapist is lynched by a mob in Kiamburi.

Residents of Narok county staged a demonstration at Duka Moja Thursday morning to protest the death of four men and a woman who died after consuming illicit brew on Wednesday night. The protesters mounted roadblocks along the Mai-Mahiu - Narok road at Duka Moja shopping centre and accused police of laxity in dealing with the sale of illicit brew.
Police in Yatta stopped a demonstration against Kalonzo Musyoka by residents of Matuu town.
West Kenya Company farmers in Bungoma county demonstrated at the Misikhu weighbridge over reduction of cane prices by the firm. Police officers monitored the protest from a distance.

A group of 39 protesters against Kakuzi Ltd, Makuyu engage police in running battles along a road connecting Kenol and Sagana. Injuries not known or reported. The protesters qualm with the company is not known.
Residents protest against the principal of a school whom they believe is corrupt.

Eight people are feared dead after about 200 heavily armed Garre militia from Ethiopia carried out an attack on the Degodia-dominated town. The attackers, who were dressed in military fatigues raided Banisa in Guba Sub-Location and targeted shops, villages, a school and a dispensary. The two clans have been recently been clashing in the area.
A group of 200 Boda Boda operators gather at Kabarnet stadium to protest against heavy handiness from police.
A clash between Garre and Degodia clans continue into a second day. Two additional combatants killed. The Garre may have been from Ethiopia, who came later to reinforce the Kenyan Garre.
Colleagues of a man beheaded by al Shabaab in Bothai protest in Maua, demanding the arrest of the perpetrators.
Twenty dead (range as high as 30) and 300 displaced as a result of a seven-hour ethnically driven gun battle in Rhamu. Police have made at least one arrest and recovered various light arms.
A vigilante mob kills a suspected thief and injures his accomplice in Sega town.
Samburu and Borana herders clash over a water source. Four killed, two each side.
Residents protest the poor state of a road.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills two, steals vehicles at Basuba location, Lamu East. Security forces later launched a security sweep of the area.

A khat driver is kidnapped by al Shabaab while three of his colleagues were attacked, robbed and released as they travelled in or near Bothai, possibly Kiunga. It was later learned the driver was beheaded sometime later.

Suspected al Shabaab attack a police post in Bothai around the midnight hour between Monday and Tuesday. The ensuing gun battle lasted five hours, eventually causing the police forces to abandon their post. After the police fled the gunmen ransacked the village, stealing drugs. Deaths reported, though no hard numbers were provided.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a quarry worker before fleeing into Somalia. Authorities speculate the motive for the attack is related to the presence of Kenya troops in Somalia.
A 27-year -old man has been lynched in Irunduni village, Tharaka, after he and two others raided a home and attempted to kidnap the wife of a prominent businessman.

Two police officers were injured during the evening hours injured after al Shabaab gunmen attacked a police station in Mandera. The gang of about 100 is said to have attacked at the Fino Police station in the night using rifles.
More than 30 villagers protested the arrest of a resident in Barwesa division, Baringo North sub county who was arrested recently for poaching. The protesters maintained his innocence.
Residents protest at a police station for the release of suspected elephant poacher, whos innocence theyve maintained.
Residents of Khwisero village in Kakamega county have lynched a man accused of killing his father.

Kenyans held peaceful demonstrations outside Kakuma refugee camp in northwest Kenya over the sacking of pregnant female employees from an international aid agency. Hundreds of local residents marched outside the UNHCR compound, demanding the reinstatement of the three employees allegedly sacked by the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) after they became pregnant.
About 100 temporary health workers in Baringo county protest in Kabarnet for permanent placement.
Student at a secondary school riot, demanding improved school provided meals.
Two are shot and killed in Garba Gola by unidentified gunmen. The reason for the killing is not known, but it should be noted one of the victims was Somali.
Residents hold a demonstrations against their districts police hiring practices.
At least 50 boda boda operators barricaded an earth road in Kericho town to protest its poor state.
Two robbery suspects were attacked by a mob at Oyugis. One killed, the second critically injured.
Students of Karaba Secondary School in Mbeere South sub county riot over a lack of eggs available in the area. One injury and property damage reported.
Unidentified gunmen attack a Mombasa-bound bus outside of Witu, kill seven, including police officers. The following morning al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Operations at a Kitui West police outpost were temporarily disrupted after members of public stormed the premises demanding speedy investigations into the killing of a villager. The exact date of the protest is not known.

Six Turkana herders have been killed during the afternoon hours following an attack by Pokot raiders on a village in Kaakong area in Kainuk location, Turkana county. Three women are among seven other people injured in the ongoing attack by cattle rustlers from the neighbouring Pokot region. There has been repeated conflict along the Pokot - Turkana border as competition for resources and cattle rustling take centre stage.

Hundreds of Nakuru residents stormed a police station in the town and set free petty crime offenders after they accused police of being involved in the death of a woman while in custody. Two officers were injured during the protests and have been hospitalized. It is not clear if this event has any relation to a similar protest in Kiptagich.
Residents protest the death of a woman who they allege died in police custody.
Demonstrators embark on a 'peace walk' from Kilifi to Kwale County (specific locations within Kwale not known) to protest against recent insecurity in the area.
In response to recent attacks in the Lamu area, Kenya air forces launch attacks on Lamu Forest, believed to be where the suspected assailants are hiding. Causalities not known.

Residents of Ngumu village in Tanadelta sub county protest against harassment by police in the ongoing operation to root out street gangs that have been killing people in the past month. The residents allege the police force witnesses to publicly point out gang members, which causes them to fear attacks from the gang.

Fresh attacks have been reported in Ras Kitua area in Lamu. Reports say gunmen raided villages in Manda Island, stole household goods and torched several houses before disappearing into Boni forest. Lamu County Commissioner Miiri Njenga says they are conducting aerial patrols to hunt down the attackers. Causalities not listed. The attack may have had occurred on 14/07.
Residents of Bomet County protest poor road construction in Cheboingong location.
Unidentified assailants attack Pandanguo location, no immediate reports of causalities.
Students from Khabukoshe Mixed Secondary School in Matungu embark on a protest against the school head, accusing the headmaster of mismanagement.

A group of 30 to 50 armed men, believed to be attached to the recent attacks in Hindi, attack Gamba police station (Ndeu area) during the evening hours. The attackers overpowered the security officers the torched the station. One officer reported dead, two others injured. Shabelle Media Network reports nine officers dead.

Thousands of protesters demonstrated in Mpeketoni over insecurity . They carried placards and twigs as they appealed to the government to curb runaway crime. They condemned the recent killings in the county and asked for speedy investigations .
At least 12 people were killed when attackers managed to get a suspected ringleader of Mpeketoni attacks out of a police station in Kenyas Tana Delta County.
At least 21 people have been killed in new attacks late in the day in Kenyas Lamu coastal region. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
Boda boda operators on lynched two suspected robbers at Gatura village in Gatanga subcounty.
A mob lynches a man in Kilgoris for suspected rape.

A group of youths stormed the Olkaria geothermal plant in Naivasha to demand for jobs. Armed with crude weapons, the irate youths paralysed operations at the Green Energy Station involved in the construction of wellhead generators. Though armed, it is not clear if the protesters used their weapons in violent manner.
A 42-year-old man was burnt to death by a vigilante mob at Imbisi village in Mumias district for killing his daughter.

St Josephs Kocholia Secondary School in Busia county was closed indefinitely. Education officials in Teso North ordered the closure of the institution after the more than 500 students boycotted classes. The students marched to the district education offices in Amagoro to seek audience with area education boss Genetrix Amatha. The students demanded the resignation of the schools Board of Management chairman Dudovicus Okitoi. They accused Okitoi of being behind the high turnover of principals at the institution.

A middle-aged man has been lynched at Shibale village. Residents said the man was behind a gang that robbed a cybercafe in Mumias town. The mob caught up with him in the town and frogmarched to River Nzoia Bridge, where he was stoned him to death and his body set ablaze.

Chaos has broken out at a fundraiser in Muhoroni constituency in a clash between supporters of MP Onyango Koyoo (NDM) and those of Kisumu county assembly majority leader Samuel Ongow (ODM). The youths allied to Ongow resisted their advance, prompting the clash. They drew out machetes against each other. Ten injuries.
Hundreds of mourners in Tetu, Nyeri county protested the murder of a mentally ill man. They said the suspect who killed the 48 year old man has not been arrested, a month after the killing.
Constituents of Gatundu South protest the result of a special election, which demonstrators believe was rigged.

Six suspected militants have been killed at the Timau police road block during a shoot out with police during the morning hours. Buuri OCPD said the six are suspected to be militants although the County Commander says the six were poachers.
A 38-year-old suspected gangster, who has been involved in a spate of robberies and killings in Rarieda subounty, is killed by a mob.

Between 10 and 15 suspected al Shabaab assailants attack Witu. A witness said that the attackers shot their victims first, made sure they bled, before tying them up and making them lie on the ground facing down. They then proceeded to hack them. The attackers are said to have vowed that they were not going to leave until they eliminate all non-believers from the area. At least 11 dead. The attack may have occurred in Maleli. As a result of the attacks, many of the residents have fled the area.
At least 20 (some reports 30) have been killed in ethnic clashes in Tarbaj involving the Degodia and Garre clans. The fighting stemmed from a boundary dispute. The clash may have occurred on 21/06.

Turkana raiders attack a Pokot village, steal cattle. Less than 24 hours Pokot raiders attack Mukutani village in Baringo South in retaliation, themselves stealing cattle. No reported death or injuries.

Five suspects linked to the two Mpeketoni attacks have been shot dead in Bochai area in Mpeketoni, Lamu county by security personnel. The ministry say three AK 47 guns and several bullets were recovered in Bochai after the incident.

Turkana raiders attack a Pokot village, steal cattle. Less than 24 hours Pokot raiders attack Mukutani village in Baringo South in retaliation, themselves stealing cattle. No injuries reported at either site. Earlier in the week Turkana raiders struck at several locations in Tiati.

On 18 June 2014, demonstrators at Suswa Trading Centre paralyzed traffic, robbed civilians and injured police forces on the Narok-Mai Mahiu highway, denouncing the alleged grabbing of farm land of the Kedong ranch by government through power generating companies. [size=no report]

More than 300 parents from Loldia primary school in Kasarani, Naivasha took to streets to protest the death of a 12-year-old boy who committed suicide last week. Transport along the busy North Lake road was paralysed as parents protested, blaming the school management for the death of the pupil. Anti-riot police stopped the demonstrators from entering the school.

Residents of Mpeketoni in Lamu County have held protests in the town following the killing several people by gunmen on Sunday and Monday nights. The residents held placards and lit bonfires in the town to protest the deaths and the destruction of property by suspected al Shabaab militia which occurred on Sunday followed by fresh attacks the previous evening.

Turkana raiders attack several locations in Tiati sub-county (Silale, Choken, Kapetareng, Ioangii, Nadome, Calvat, KangoIio , ApIdiny, Chepisya, Naratito, Konghituw, and Nakwiadicho), killing four and stealing cattle.

Turkana raiders attack several locations in Tiati sub-county (Silale, Choken, Kapetareng, Ioangii, Nadome, Calvat, KangoIio , ApIdiny, Chepisya, Naratito, Konghituw, and Nakwiadicho), killing four and stealing cattle.

Osonkoroi Secondary School in Trans Mara subdistrict has been closed indefinitely after student protest. The students walked out of the school to demand the removal of their head teacher. They beat up and injured the deputy principal who had arrived at the school early in the morning. Students then trekked for six kilometres to Trans Mara West education office in Kilgoris town where they sought audience with subcounty education officer .

Osonkoroi Secondary School in Trans Mara subdistrict has been closed indefinitely after student protest. The students walked out of the school to demand the removal of their head teacher. They beat up and injured the deputy principal who had arrived at the school early in the morning. Students then trekked for six kilometres to Trans Mara West education office in Kilgoris town where they sought audience with subcounty education officer .

At least 10 more people were killed during the night-time hours in a second attack in Mpeketoni, Porokomo, Lamu County area by al Shabaab. Police said gunmen raided Poromoko village and set several houses ablaze. Al Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack claiming they had killed 20 police and wildlife wardens. Other sources claim 15 deaths.
Rival schools riot against each other, throw stones and destroy property.
Two Turkana children are shot dead by unidentified raiders in the early afternoon.
A group of mourners staged a protest outside the Naivasha Subcounty Hospital mortuary over the killing of their relative. A relative said the victim was killed after a business deal went sour.

Somali al Shabaab carjack two police vans in Witu, drive to Mpekatoni where they began opening fire on people in the street. It was later learned the attackers singled out-non Muslims before they opened fire. Areas affected were Mpeketoni Police station, two hotels, a bank and a fuel station. One of the hotels was burnt down in the attack. It is not clear if police forces returned fire. Out of the 60 people reported missing after the Mpeketoni clashes 8 people are yet to be accounted for. At least 57 people died in the attack.
More than 200 residents blocked the Nyeri-Nyahururu highway near Mwiyogo (Moyo Drift Farms) to protest against rising insecurity. This was the second such protest in five days.
Transport operators in Kuria West sub county held a demonstration at Kehancha town over poor roads. The demonstration proceeded to Ikerege and Taranganya towns for several hours.
Transport operators in Kuria West sub county held a demonstration at Kehancha town over poor roads. The demonstration proceeded to Ikerege and Taranganya towns for several hours.
Transport operators in Kuria West sub county held a demonstration at Kehancha town over poor roads. The demonstration proceeded to Ikerege and Taranganya towns for several hours.

Residents of Gatanga constituency, Muranga county, protested against political interference by TNA. They accused some politicians from the area, who were defeated in last years general election, of undermining area MP Humphrey Njuguna and sabotaging his development.

Transport on the Narok-Mai Mahiu highway was paralysed for more than four hours when youths blocked the road at Ntulele trading centre in Narok county. The residents protested over the takeover of a probox stage by another community whom they say have refused to employ Maasai youths from the area. They complained of harassment by traffic officers.
Residents protest along the Nyeri-Nyahururu road against rising insecurity on the area.
Traders riot in protest the government-led destruction of their structures, stoning car and damaging property. Police arrest several.
Street traders hold a demonstration in protest of the demolition of their shops. The demonstrations took place throughout the town.
A women's group protest a political candidate electoral nomination fee at Baraza Park in Kwale.

Twelve people from the Degodia clan were during the nighttime hours killed when militia from the Garre clan raided Gunane village in Tarbaj constituency. Seven others are admitted to the Wajir District Hospital with serious injuries. Wajir county commissioner Naftali Mungathia said the militia stormed the village at around 11pm and hurled a rocket propelled grenade at the villagers who were asleep. Conflicting reports hold 18 deaths.

Suspected al-Shabaab militants killed two Kenya Defense Forces (KDF) soldiers and injured another at the common frontier with Somalia, police have said. The divisional police commander, who confirmed the incident, said the officers were attacked by the insurgents who emerged from the bonny forest along Lamu-Malindi road on a Pick-Up vehicle.

An Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) Coordinator was killed by unidentified assailants in Nanyuki town. The attackers shot the IEBC official three times in the chest, stole some items off his person, and fled. It is not clear if the perpetrators targeted their victim for political reasons or theft. The attack occurred during the morning hours.
A vigilante group attacked and injured three suspected robbers who were later revealed to be plain clothes police officers.
Farmers who had gathered at the Bukembe market protest a delay of dues from the sugar cane production company they had contracted under.
An AP Officer from Imenti South District was lynched by residents for unknown reason. His wife, who was near him, was injured.
Unidentified attackers raid a police camp, making off with weapons. No reported injuries or causalities.

Traders at Kiganjo market in Gatundu South, Kiambu county protested over the lack of toilets at their premises. They said five years after the open-air market was rehabilitated, toilets have not been built yet they pay rates and levies to the Kiambu government.
A thief is lynched by a vigilante group.

The funeral of a politicians wife is disrupted by clashes of opposing political parties, namely supporters of after Governor Okoth Obado and Siaya Senator James Orengo of the PDM and ODM. Injuries not known.
Police in Diani Town of Kwale County [southern Kenya] on [25 April] morning gunned down an Al-Shabab terror suspect they believe has been behind a spate of criminal activities.
Five are hurt during a ethnically driven clash over rights to a pasture.

Residents of four villages in Mukogodo division, Laikipia North subcounty held a peaceful demonstration against a private ranch for being sidelined in employment. The residents from Lekiji, Ilmotiok, Koija and Tiamamut said Mpala Research Centre is sourcing for workers, including watchmen and guides from outside the subcounty.

A section of residents of Ikutha market in Kitui county have demanded the transfer of area police boss. Boda boda operators, hawkers and hotel operators held a march against Korir on the streets of Ikutha market. The protesters believe the chief is too 'heartless.'
A 45-year-old man was lynched by residents of Mukothima in Tharaka South for allegedly shooting and killing a youth.

A Member of Kibiri Ward representative in Rachuonyo North Sub County within Homa Bay County has been shot dead at his home on this morning by unidentified assailants. The motive for the attack is not known.
A vigilante mob attacks, lynches and kills a suspected thief. Date vague; occurred during the weekend.
Five herdsmen sustained gunshot wounds during a cattle raid at Nadome village in Tiaty sub county, Baringo. The suspects are believed to be Turkana.
Kenyans protested against discrimination and harassment by Ugandan security forces on the island. The Ugandan police have arbitrarily arrested fisherman and disallowed fishing in certain areas.
One dead in land dispute violence.
Residents of Karaini lynch a man on suspicion of murder.

Two people were injured during a street protest against the Nandi government in Kapsabet town - A group of youth demonstrating over alleged corruption, nepotism and being sidelined in tendering for projects were confronted by a rival group supporting Governor Cleophas Lagat.
Residents of Butere constituency demonstrated against MP Andrew Tobosos portraits on CDF projects. They said Toboso has been using CDF projects for political mileage.
Traders whose shops were last week demolished by the West Pokot government held a peaceful demonstration in Makutano town. They said the government gave them a short notice before the demolition.

More than 150 families from Manda-Maweni village in Lamu county have protest the alleged grabbing of a quarry. The families stormed the county government offices and demanded that a tycoon in the area be ordered to leave.

Youths from Othaya protested over a local CDF project, saying they were left out of its construction. The youths from Witima village said there was favouritism in the award of the tender for the Sh1.5 million Unjiru Community Hall.

Residents of Mukogodo division in Laikipia North district demonstrated against 'sand theft'. They said they have been deprived of revenue. The residents obstructed the Ilpolei-Doldol road for several hours, blocking lorries that transport sand from the collection points.
Residents protest traffic fines from police, believing they are overly hash and unwarranted. Exact date of the protest vague.
Two suspected kidnappers were lynched during the night-time hours at Teret in Njoro.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines. Of the dead, two were killed on 07/03 and three on 08/03.
Residents held a peaceful demonstration over the poor state of Mpeketoni District Hospital.
Bondeni residents in Mvita constituency protested over the increased use of drugs by youths.

A group of farmers clashed with pastoralists over grazing land around Lake Naivasha. The farmers who claim to be members of the Mau Mau group accused the herders of driving their animals into the farms. Causalities not known or reported.
Farmers protest against 'strict rules' on obtaining subsidized fertilizer.
Two middle-aged men were killed by a mob at Sigor centre in West Pokot county during the evening hours. They had been mistaken for child traffickers.
Sugarcane farmers in Trans Mara District protest a tax on their product.

Six people were injured during a confrontation between farmers and pastoralists at Mtondoni area in Hongwe ward, Lamu West district. The conflict ensued when pastoralists were accused of driving their animals into the farms and destroying crops. The identities of the two groups is not known.
More than 5,000 traders in Muhoroni sub county have threatened to boycott paying taxes due to lack of proper market facilities during a demonstration.
Residents of Ogwedhi kill two suspected cattle rustlers.

Members of the Ogiek community protest against the bid to evict them from the disputed Ngongogeri Farm in Nakuru County by police authorities. Government authorities claimed the settlers were harming the local wildlife.
Residents of Central Kadem location, Nyatike constituency have lynched a man for poisoning their cows.

A man is killed in Taveta following fighting over a land dispute. Witnesses said the deceased, who is the land owner, had gone to mark the boundary of their land at Makongeni area when they were attacked by unknown assailants.

Students of Rongo University demonstrated against the death of their colleague. They blocked the busy Rongo-Migori road as police lobbed teargas canisters in the air to disperse them. The students said their colleague, a first year student bio-chemistry student, died due to alleged negligence by the administration. During the protest students vandalised and looted shops in Rongo town and near by shopping centres.
Mombasa county government chief inspector of Logistic and Planning is shot and killed, along with his companion. The assailants are believed to be of or in league with al Shabaab.

Youth from Endorois community engaged police in a riot. The chaos led to the closing of Nyahururu- Kinamba Road for long hours. The youth were protesting against alleged grabbing of a 1,600 acre plot at Tuiyobei in Marigat district, Baringo. No reported causalities.

Homa Bay town residents paralysed business at the county assembly after members of the county assembly members rejected five candidates nominated as chief officers. The demonstrators backed by hundreds of boda boda operators tried to storm the assembly chambers to evict the MCAs but were stopped by anti-riot police. No violence reported.

A group of men from Kericho West attacked Nyakach during the overnight hours in revenge over stolen cattle. Several houses were torched, leaving many displaced and homeless. No report of death or injury. The exact date of the raid is not clear.
Lorry and matatu drivers and touts protested against the poor state of the Makutano-Alale road in Makutano town, West Pokot county.
Hotel and bar attendants protest for higher wages.

Residents of Got Nyango village in Karachuonyo sub county, Homa Bay county held a peaceful demonstration over iron ore mining in the area. The residents said the company has not honoured the agreement they made previously.
A suspected cattle thief, believed to be a Ugandan, was killed by residents of Ochude location in Teso South district.
Coffee farmers demonstrate in the streets surrounding their factory over pay.

The more than 200 youth, armed with weapons raided a sand harvesting site in Kedong Ranch and set the lorries ablaze. The attack follows a fall-out between traders and the youth from Mai Mahiu over control of the sand business.

Students of Mosoriot Teachers Training College in Nandi held demonstrations following the suspicious death of their colleague. They are also opposed to a plan to upgrade the institution into a university. The more than 1,000 students barricaded the busy Eldoret-Kapsabet-Kisumu highway with huge boulders. Police shot into the air to disperse the group.

Tambach High School in Elgeyo Marakwet has been closed following student protests during the night time hours. The students were protesting the banning of weekend night entertainment and teacher harassment. Police were called in after the students threatened to destroy property.
Four people have been confirmed dead after raiders, suspected to be Pokots, ambushed Turkana herdsmen at Juluk in Turkana South sub-county.

Ethiopian Merrile militia attack a group of fishermen in the north-west Turkana border district, on Lake Turkana, killing one and injuring several others. The motive for the attack is not clear, though several similar raid had been persistent in the area. Responding to the fishermens distress calls, Kenyan police battled the Merrile, pushing them back into Ethiopia. No causality figures provided from the police battle.

Ethiopian Merrile militia attack a group of fishermen in the north-west Turkana border district, on Lake Turkana, killing one and injuring several others. The motive for the attack is not clear, though several similar raid had been persistent in the area. Responding to the fishermens distress calls, Kenyan police battled the Merrile, pushing them back into Ethiopia. No causality figures provided from the police battle.
Traders in Muranga have protest against new tax rates proposed by the county government. The demonstrations began late 21/01 and continued into 22/01.
More than 300 traders operating in Nakuru town staged a demonstration along Nakuru, Eldoret highway after they found their stalls destroyed by officers of county government.
Traders in Muranga have protest against new tax rates proposed by the county government. The demonstrations began late 21/01 and continued into 22/01.

Kiaga Coffee Factory farmers demonstrate outside the company premises in protest of slated sale plans. The protesters believed the planned sale to a cooperative society, which typically pay less than that of private millers.

A senior Mijikenda Kayak elder was shot dead by unknown gangsters during the evening hours at his home in Jamb area of Wartime. Family members said the man had no local grudges and they had no idea of the motive.
Parents of enrolled students gathered at Pap Oriang Primary school in Siaya county to protest the transfer of its head teacher.
Mtune villagers at Vanga-LungaLunga in Kwale protest lack of water, secondary schools and health facilities.

Unidentified militia, believed to be from nearby Ethiopia attack the ethnic Gabra border town of North Horr, killing two police and injuring 'scores' of civilians. It was reported cattle was stolen in the raid.
A man suspected of stealing motorcycles is lynched in Laikipia West.
Students staged a sit-in protest, shutting down their against the transfer of their principal.

A group of youth riot, apparently in an effort to disrupt an election in Kiranja. The youth, some of whom were intoxicated, engaged police in fierce fights. Police manning the polling centre had to call for reinforcement from Kerugoya town. Three people were injured during the fracas. The intended effect of the unrest was to aid a local candidate who the youth perceived to be beneficial to farmers.
One is killed and two are others injured in a ethnic clash over the course of two days.
One is killed and two are others injured in a ethnic clash over the course of two days.

An unknown number of people are feared dead (coded as 3) and several others injured in Marsabit following fresh attacks by bandits believed to be from Ethiopia. The attack comes just days after four people were killed in the relative area over a water hole dispute, though it is not clear if this attack was motivated by ethnicity.

A man is lynched by a group of residents over suspected theft. Another suspected thief was killed by a mob on in nearby Koimugo village in Embu town days earlier. It is not clear if the two vigilante groups are related.
Parents of students enrolled at a primary school protest near its entrance, demanding the head teachers transfer following a poor school-wide test result.
A hand grenade is thrown at a police officer in the Diani area. The ordinance did not explode. The perpetrators escaped.
A middle-aged man was killed in the morning hours by a vigilante mob in Majaoni, Kilifi county. It was believed the man was accused of planning the killing of his sister-in-law.

At least ten are injured in a grenade attack at a nightclub in Diani, 25km outside of Mombasa. The attack occurred around 4am. Witnesses claim they saw an individual lob the explosive into a group of people, though the persons identity remain unknown. The target of the blast may have been a group of British tourists present in the bar.

A band of residents of Gathuri village in Maragua constituency, Muranga county have torched the houses of two old women suspected of practicing witchcraft. No reported injury or death. [women targeted: accused of witchcraft/sorcery]
Residents of Rironi shopping centre in Kiambu county protest a recent high crime wave.

A Kenya police reservist was shot dead by unidentified armed raiders in a fresh attack at Turkwel on Pokot-Turkana border. The police officer of the Turkana ethnic group, though it was not clear if ethnicity was the motive for the attack.

A Muslim cleric has been shot dead by two gunmen at Kona ya Musa in Diani, Kwale county. The cleric was shot in the head unknown people a few metres from his business some minutes after evening prayers on 18/12.

More than 300 residents from Kamukunji village in Solia, Nakuru held a peaceful demonstration over a power black out that has lasted for five days. The residents said the Kenya Power has not rectified the problem despite numerous reports.
Matau operators in Mwingi Central district protest the influx of probox vehicles in Mwingi town. The group claimed the probox vehicles do not have hold the proper certifications.
Al Shabaab launches an attack on a border town, killing three civilians and five police. Liboi hosts an AMISOM military, often used to supply forces in Somalia.

Two General Service Unit officers (paramilitary wing of the Kenyan Military) were injured when a vehicle they were travelling in was attacked in West Pokot county. The attackers may have been thieves.
A man is lynched by a group of boda boda operators for the suspected murder of their colleague two weeks ago. The man was rescued by police before death.

Police forces gun down Hassan Suleiman Mwayuyu, an al Shabaab suspect while travelling by bus. The Kenya Standard reported a battle between the actors, but HRW conflicted this story. Police believed Mwayuyu had be planning grenade attacks on Mombasa.
A 13-year-old boy is shot and killed by suspected Turkana raiders in Kamurio village on Pokot-Turkana border.

At least 12 people were killed with many others injured in Marsabit county of northern Kenya following clashes between rival militia groups, Borana and Burji, Gabra. The clash caused 30,000 nearby Moyale residents, fearing for their safety, to flee north into Ethiopia. Clashes were sporadic throughout the week, though no specific date is provided. Some sources have causality totals at 70 or more.

Residents of Mumias town protest threats by Kakamega Governor Wycliffe Oparanya to evict Mumias Sugar Company managers from the firm. Traders closed their shops to join the protestors who sang anti-Oparanya songs. The residents wished the government would subsidise the company financially.

Journalists in Nandi held a peaceful demonstration on Kapsabet town streets to protest a proposed media bill. The scribes appealed to MPs to reject it as they believe it would violate the constitution.
Journalists protest against a proposed amendment to the Kenya Information and Communication Bill through the streets of Kitui.
Turkana militia raid Orwa town in West Pokot, killing a young boy and destroying property. In an act of revenge the villagers of Orwa mobilized, killing a man in the nearby Turkana village of Runo.
Turkana militia raid Orwa town in West Pokot, killing a young boy and destroying property. In an act of revenge the villagers of Orwa mobilized, killing a man in the nearby Turkana village of Runo.
Residents of Adungosi trading centre forcefully evicted 30 suspected criminals from their homes in Teso. No reported causalities.

Police forces launch an operation to retake police posts occupied by Pokot militia. The Pokot militiamen responded with 'heavy resistance.' It is not clear if the operation was successful. Causalities not known.

Armed Pokot militiamen attack and hold hostage three police posts in Lorokon village. It is not clear how many police officers are effected by the attack. Causalities not known. The siege is likely related to a border dispute between the Pokots and Turkana communities that has been causing tension in the area.

Residents in Narok block the entire Mai Mahiu Narok highway near Lake Turkana to protest the killing of about 40 goats by a lorry the previous evening. The group who saw the road as treacherous demanded they be compensated for their loss. The protest disrupted traffic, but caused no reported damage.
A vigilante group lynches two on suspicion of witchcraft.
Two men were in the evening hours shot dead at Kasses village in West Pokot by suspected raiders.

A suspected rapist is lynched by a mob in Kiritiri. Eye witnesses said the residents pounced on him and tied his hands and legs with a rope before starting battering him with all manner of weapons. Police rescued the man shortly before death.

Hundreds of residents from Kwanza constituency converged at Namanjalala along Namanjalala Zea road today and demonstrated against impassable roads. Carrying placards and chanting songs for their rights, the residents planted bananas on the road from Namanjalala to Liyavo, a distance of two kilometres, blaming local government officials.
An unidentified man hacks a woman to death in a land dispute.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Health Workers (Kenya); Aid Workers (Kenya)
notes: A Red Cross officer is shot and injured by an armed group after delivering supplies to Nakwamoru village.
A vigilante mob killed two men after accusing them of being witch doctors.
1,000 market traders protest a move by the Taita-Taveta County Government to relocate them near the Kenya-Tanzania border.
A clash between Ganze police and MRC youths leads to a gunshot wound of a bystander civilian.

A middle aged Pokot man was shot and killed while grazing animals at Chepurwo village in Ombolion location by suspected armed raiders from the neighbouring county. The raiders did not steal the victims animals.

Residents of Sala Location in Tana River County at the weekend staged protests against a company building the 37.5 billion Sala Gravity Canal. The protest arose over differences between the residents and the company over employment opportunities and sub-contracts for locals.
Journalists in Northern Kenya took to the streets to protest a recently passed media bill which they believe would set limits on the press freedom.

A group of youth blocked the Kitui-Machakos road to protest against sand harvesting at Tiva River. The youth put boulders at Mulutu trading centre at 7am to intercept lorries ferrying sand from the river.

Three people were shot dead after youths armed with arrows attacked Ruga police post in Muhoroni Sub County. The three are reported to have been shot dead in an arrow and fire exchange at Nyangore sub-location in Chemelil. The youths are suspected to have come from Nandi community. The youths had vowed to kill a senior police officer, accusing police of contributing to the rampant chaos along the nearby border area.

Two students were killed at Laikipia University. The first died accidentally when a traffic police officer driving on the Nyahururu- Nakuru road knocked him down at Nyumba Tatu trading centre. The accident triggered a riot by the university students that culminated in the killing of yet another student as Nyahururu police engaged the students in running battles.

More than 200 residents of Ragati village of Karatina, Nyeri protest the alleged grabbing of community land. They marched to the Mathira East sub county commissioners office where they accused their chief and senior lands officers of aiding unscrupulous businessmen to grab more than six acres set aside for social amenities in the village.

Youth in Limuru barricaded the Nairobi-Nakuru Highway protesting against a Kiambu County financial bill. The bill proposes to charge fees for county cemeteries, church crusades and slaughtering of animals among other charges proposed by the county government.
Residents of Flamingo estate in Nakuru town protest poor area sanitation.

A university student is killed and one shot in the leg by police in demonstrations in Maralal over insecurity. Several shops and offices have closed in the area due to fear of looting as protestors engage police in running battles.
A group of jobless youth in Kitui have protest the high qualifications set by the county in employing its staff.
Othaya More than 100 students from Kagonye Mixed Secondary School in Othaya, Nyeri county stage a walk-out from their classes in protest of school administration.
Street vendors gather to protest the killing of their donkeys by suspected thieves.
Tullow Oil Kenya halts production due to demonstrations by area residents demanding to be employed at the companies sites, including Ngamia 1 and Twiga 1, which are its biggest operations.
Sugarcane growers blockade Enoosaen-Awendo road with lit fires in protest of cane prices.
Residents in Keroka protest poor delivery services.
A suspected goat thief is lynched by a vigilante mob.

Street hawkers operating in Nakuru town protest against allocation of public land to two developers. The hawkers marched to the Kenya Railways yard and brought down a wire fence said to have been erected by the developers.
About 200 pupils of Osasame Primary School in Teso North protest the lack of instructional materials.
A suspected motorbike thief is lynched a vigilante group and nearly killed before he is rescued by police.
A church pastor is 'hacked to death' by an unidentified assailant.
A vigilante mob burns the home of a suspected murderer, killing his two children. Several days later the suspect died of injuries sustained from the fire.
Four people have died following inter-Tribal conflict in Waso Rongai Village, Baragoi. The groups involved were not identified.
Students of Tsimba Secondary School in Kwale on demonstrated to protest what they said is mistreatment by their principal.

Students at the Kirinyaga University College protest for the removal of the institutions principal due to an increase of student fees. Police engage the group and there are several accounts of violence between them.

Residents protest the lack of title deeds provided by the government in Macalder town in Nyatike district. They asked President Uhuru and Lands Secretary Charity Ngilu to give them the deeds to their property.
A man is shot and killed with arrows along the on the Chemelil-Nandi border. The reason for the attack is not known.
A group of police who were returning from patrol opened fire on a group of men planting an IED along the side of the road the night of 11/10. The police failed to hit or capture any of the men.
An unknown group attacked a Giriama village near Kipini in the Tana River Delta, burning three homes.

After a Boda boda rider was gunned down by a suspected police official for unknown reason, several of the victims delivery comrades protest the shooting. Several days later the group officially entered a labour strike in further protest. It is not clear when the protest to the shooting occurred, as it may have been the following day or later.

After a Boda boda rider was gunned down by a suspected police official for unknown reason, several of the victims delivery comrades protest the shooting. Several days later the group officially entered a labour strike in further protest.
A man who allegedly killed this 100-year-old grandmother is lynched by a band of locals.

A crowd of squatters believed to be composed of Nandi youths invaded a farm belonging to a former judge and attacked an AP officer who was guarding the premise. The motive for the attack is believed to be concerning the control of land.

The Yiaku community living on Kurikuri Group Ranch in Mukogodo division protest at the border of the Kurikuri and Makurian group ranches in what they alleged was bias from the provincial administration over a land division conflict.

The more than 200 cross-border Ugandan-Pokot raiders attacked Apuko village in Pokot North and drove away the animals after a fierce morning battle with Pokot herdsmen and security officers. Causalities not known.

The more than 200 cross-border Ugandan-Pokot raiders attacked Apuko village in Pokot North and drove away the animals after a fierce morning battle with Pokot herdsmen and security officers. Causalities not known.
Hundreds of women in Nandi County staged demonstrations against the sale of alcoholic drinks to school children.
Boda boda protesters demonstrate against government harassment after refusing to pay a highway levy.
A Isiolo tomato farmer is killed at Isiolo-Meru border in what the security agents say is a revenge attack from the Meru.
A robbery suspect is killed by a vigilante group.
Four robbery suspects were set on fire at Kamwimbi by a vigilante group.
Six people were injured after they were attacked in a suspected land control disagreement.
A vigilante mob morning beat to death a suspected thief of a home in Kagaa village in Maragua.
Garre and Degodia militia clashed at Meriley water dam in Banissa District in the afternoon of 16/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. No causalities reported.

A student at Angata Barikoi Secondary School was shot dead by suspected Kuria cattle rustlers in Oldonyorok, Trans Mara West district. It is not clear if the attack was ethnically based. The attack occurred in the late evening of 16/09.
Three people were shot dead when armed assailants of Somali origin attacked a remote village in Malalani location, Kitui East constituency. The violence may have escalated from an argument.
More than 100 boda boda operators protest outside the DC offices over insecurity and theft in the area.
An administrating police officer attack a 68 year old woman in Kakemer village in Teso North for unknown reason.
A woman is killed and two pupils seriously injured when Pokot raiders invaded Lokoron. The motive for the attack may have been ethic.
Four suspected gangsters were lynched by an angry mob after they tried to rob a businessman in Viyalo village, Sabatia constituency, Vihiga County.
Eight people were killed in what is believed to be a revenge attack in Ntirango and Loliondo villages of Lolgorian division, Trans Mara West District.
A group of Ethiopian Dassanach cross the shared border and kill a police reservist along the west bank of the Lake Turkana.
Dassanach raiders enter Kenya near Lake Turkana, kill a police reservist and injure two others at a post at Loarengak.

An Administration Police officer shot a businessman in Marakwet East before he was attacked and killed by an angry mob. It is not clear why the officer opened fire. The trader was rushed to the hospital and is expected to survive.

An Administration Police officer shot a businessman in Marakwet East before he was attacked and killed by an angry mob. It is not clear why the officer opened fire. The trader was rushed to the hospital and is expected to survive.

Irate Bodaboda taxi Drivers from Limuru lynched a suspected motorbike thief after he was caught driving to a garage in Kwambira shopping centre. The mob was drown from Ngaraiga and Kamirithu villages. They beat the suspect known as Maina to death using stones, hardwood and metal bars.
Kenyan forces stationed in Madera County chase several al Shabaab fighters into Beled Hawo following cross-border gunfire. Causalities not known.
Unidentified assailants petrol bomb a civilian couples house for unknown reason. They two suffered injury and were taken to a nearby hospital.

Twenty Al-Shabab militiamen are killed by the Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] near the border town of Hulugho, Garissa. The militants were crossing the border to Somalia and are believed to be part of a group of nearly 40 militiamen who attacked an Administration Police camp at Galmagala Division last Friday [16 August] evening killing four Administration Police officers.
A man is hacked to death by unknown assailants at his home in Vitengeni, Kilifi county.
An ethnic clash over land caused one death along the Trans Mara West and Kuria East district border.
More than 3,000 families have fled their homes at the Kenya-Ethiopia border following the killing of ten fisherman by unknown Ethiopia militia.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.

Residents of Kanyaltin in West Pokot county protest over illegal logging at Kapkanyar forest by rogue traders. Led by Pokot South MP David Kosing, the residents asked the government to stop the cutting of trees that has now created tension in the area.
A impromptu mob lynches a suspected thief.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Seven Kenyan fishermen operating in Lake Turkana have been killed by Murle militiamen from Ethiopia. Another 20 fishermen are missing.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Residents of Tangisir village in Meibeki/Karuna ward lynched a herdsman after he admitted to defiling and killing a seven-year-old nursery school girl.

A group of people living with disabilities protested at Ol Kalou town in Nyandarua county at the weekend. The group was objecting to the nomination of their representatives to the county assembly. The protesters said it is wrong for able-bodied people to take up seats reserved for people living with disabilities. The nominees are set to be sworn in next week.
At least four fishermen are dead in Lake Turkana after suspected Merille militia from neighbouring Ethiopia attacked them.
Boda boda operators in Rongo town protest against the increase of operating charges from Sh80 to Sh100.
Protesting students of Mwandango High School block teachers from entering campus in an effort to stop them from administering an examination.

Maasai homeowners began a violent protest against a forced government eviction of their homes. The evictees and their supporters threw stones and lifted clubs against visiting Rift Valley Provincial Commissioner Osman Warfa and his security team, accusing them of standing by as the families were forced from their residences illegally. Windscreens of some of the officials vehicles were shattered. The reason for the eviction is not clear.

A man has been lynched by a mob in Mariakani, Mombasa, after he was suspected to be behind a cartel that has been harassing and stealing motorbikes from boda boda operators.

A group of Boda Boda Riders (motorcycle group) gather to protest the killing of two of their colleagues by gangsters. The group called on the police to investigate the case. Police dispersed the group with teargas and made over 120 arrests.
'One security guard for an NGO was shot when he interrupted what was likely an attempted armed robbery of an NGO compound in Dadaab.'

40 people, including two government officials, were held hostage by gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab militia from Somalia in Hullugho border town. The gunmen apprehended the group while the were travelling from Masalani.

At fifteen are dead after a group of hired thugs attack a small village during the overnight hours. Ten of those killed were from three families and included three children while the other two victims were a school boy and a man who bumped into the attackers as they left the village. Authorities believe the attackers were hired by a rival family seeking land.

Clashes continue between the Tugen and Pokot communities in Baringo county. Escalation of hostilities since January has, according to the Kenya Red Cross Society (KRCS), left more than 7,500 Tugen people displaced from their homes, living either with other members of their community or in rudimentary shelters in the bush.
